item.description: Background Marco Fratarcangeli has been a Professor of Computer Science until 2021 at the Chalmers University of Technology in Gothenburg, Sweden. His main academic interests are visual computing and computer graphics, particularly animation. His recent research is focused on physically-based simulation, using state-of-the-art nonlinear optimization methods and massively parallel graphics hardware. He has been an Associate Professor (2016-2020) at Chalmers, an Assistant Professor (2011-2014) at Sapienza University in Rome (Italy), and a visiting professor (2014) at Telecom Paristech in Paris (France).
